description: Would change the world
Looks good, but not can push...
I use it to browse the history of git projects. Simple to use and really efficient.
gitg has been my go-to git repo viewer for a while. I don't use it to manage my repos, but it is a very good viewer and requires no complex configuration.
Simple, not many features and mainly crashes when a solution of hundreds of files being added. Would recommend Git GUI instead.
It can be pretty slow when trying to load big commits, unfortunately. But for small git repos, it's nice.
It's now my favourite graphical git manager!

This is really good, minimalistic and well designed app. However, it is best suitable for small git repos. Gitg hangs with huge git repos, that have large number of staging/committed files, because it tries to display them all.
Doesn't allow you to add changes or view uncommitted changes.

Awesome git browser for linux systems. 
Just missing 2 features:
- dark mode/theme (please!!)
- pull/push functionality (official, with agent support)
Not possible to use this app in every day development. When I checkout some certain branches, or even switch to them in the list, the app hangs for sometime and then crashes with SEGFAULT.
summary: Crashes with SEGFAULT on some branches, loads 100% of one of cores

description:
Good, but after version 3 usability has deteriorated.
Important things hidden in the Preferences menu
summary: Good, but after version 3 usability has deteriorated

description: Gitg has many useful features, such as the ability to commit separate lines and hunks of a diff, and a decent view of the log graph. But it's not a great client yet. It lacks the ability to view a custom set of branches for example. You can see either the current branch or all branches. There is also no way to see a diff between 2 arbitrary commits, which is important.
summary: One of the best clients for linux

description:
Error 

unable to install gitg: 
gitg-3.26.0-1.el7.x86_64 requires libgit2-glib-1.0.so.0()(64bit)

Can someone help me install this with instructions to my email anonymous9coder@gmail.com
basic to the point of useless
summary: basic to the point of useless

description: I even could not understand which branch is I currently on or how to pull rebase. It shows my branch 20 commits back from origin but how to rebase only god knows.

The functionality is a bit limited, but it fits well into the Gnome interface. It is enough to view the history of your commits and possibly create new ones. I would not say that this application is useless, it has its justification.

A nice git client, making it easy to see commit history, view branches, and especially, to make partial commits.
I fixed the version at 0.2.7, as newer versions didn't have partial commit option anymore.
summary: Very good, but I fixed version at 0.2.7 for now

description: Cant tell if the app has frozen or there's no interaction for certain UI elements, gave up and moved on
summary: Constant UI hangs on a fresh repo

description: No sé por qué, pero no se pueden clonar repositorios,... no deja de sorprenderme la mala calidad de algunos programas en Debian estable. Tuve que reemplazarlo por Giggle.
Se puede clonar y subir repositorios pero no me quedo muy claro como hacer un commit de los cambios y seguido un push. 3 estrellas por que esta en español y es algo de agradecer
Interfaz simple y bien diseñada, pero hace falta un rediseño de la vista de diffs, un cuadro enano con mala paleta de colores no es suficiente.
